title: Public transport during the Cadel Evans Great Ocean Road Race 2025: Wednesday 29 January to Sunday 2 February 2025
articleContent:
• Jump to Wednesday 29 and Thursday 30 January
  • Jump to Saturday 1 February
  • Jump to Sunday 2 February

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey Planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

Make your journey hassle-free and remember to top up your myki and have it ready to use before travelling.

Please refer to the Cadel Evans Great Ocean Road Race website for further event information, road closures and accessibility information.

Planned closures

Due to the Cadel Evans Great Ocean Road Race in Geelong, the Bellarine and Surf Coast bus Routes 1, 20, 24, 30, 31, 41, 42, 43, 50, 51, 52, 53, 54, 55, 56, 60, 61 and 101 (Apollo Bay to Geelong) will experience delays, be diverted in both directions and selected bus stops will not be serviced on Wednesday 29 January, Thursday 30 January, Saturday 1 and Sunday 2 February 2025.

Additionally, on Saturday 1 February, the Warrnambool Line will be suspended between Waurn Ponds and Warrnambool, affecting the 1:10pm Southern Cross to Warrnambool and 5:36pm Warrnambool to Melbourne services. Replacement coaches will be available from Geelong Station.

Wednesday 29 and Thursday 30 January

 Regional train

Getting to Geelong

Passengers can catch regular services arriving at Geelong and Marshall Railway Station and connect with bus services to Torquay.

Leaving Geelong

Passengers can return via bus services from Torquay and catch regular services departing Geelong and Marshall Railway Station.

Regional bus

Stop changes from 1pm to 3:30pm

Due to road closures on Bell Street and The Esplanade for the Surf Coast Classic, the following bus stops will not be serviced on Routes 52, 53 and 54:

  • Price Street/The Esplanade

Stop changes from first to last service

Due to road closures on Mountjoy Parade, the following bus stops will not be serviced on the Geelong to Apollo Bay coach services:

  • Lorne Hotel/Great Ocean Road

Passengers can use the following alternative stops:

  • Lorne Visitor Centre/Great Ocean Road
  • Anglesea Motor Inn/Great Ocean Road

Saturday 1 February

 Regional train

Getting to Geelong

Passengers can catch regular services arriving at Geelong Railway Station.

Due to the suspension of services on the Warrnambool Line between Waurn Ponds and Warrnambool, the following services will be affected and replacement coaches will be available for passengers from Geelong Station.

  • 1:10pm Southern Cross to Warrnambool
  • 5:36pm Warrnambool to Melbourne

Leaving Geelong

Passengers can catch regular services departing Geelong Railway Station.

Regional bus

Due to temporary and rolling road closures in place for the People’s Ride and UCI Women’s Elite Road Race, there will be delays and service changes to bus Routes 1, 20, 22, 24, 25, 30, 31, 41, 42, 51, 52, 53, 54, 55, 56, 60, 61 and 101 (Apollo Bay - Geelong) around Geelong, the Bellarine and Surf Coast.

Stop changes from 3pm to 5pm

The following bus stops will not be serviced on bus Routes 41, 42, 53 and 55:

  • Kilgour Street/Moorabool Street
  • Lonsdale Street/Moorabool Street
  • South Geelong Station/Lonsdale Street
  • Foster Street/Moorabool Street
  • Balliang Street/Moorabool Street
  • Barwon Terrace/Moorabool Street
  • Belmont Village Shopping Centre/High Street
  • High Street/Barwon Heads Road

Stop changes from 3:30pm to 4:15pm

The following bus stops will not be serviced on bus Route 1:

  • Little Fyans Street/Moorabool Street
  • Cameron Park/High Street

  • Barwon Terrace/Moorabool Street
  • Belmont Village Shopping Centre/High Street

Stop changes from 3:15pm to 5:15pm

The following bus stops will not be serviced on bus Route 20:

  • The Esplanade/Glenleith Avenue
  • Toorak Parade/The Esplanade

  • Mercer Street/The Esplanade

Stop changes from 3pm to 5pm

The following bus stops will not be serviced on bus Route 24:

  • Church Street/Minerva Road
  • Arthur Street/Church Street
  • Kilgour Street/Moorabool Street
  • Lonsdale Street/Moorabool Street
  • Foster Street/Moorabool Street
  • Latrobe Boulevard/Fyans Street

Stop changes from 3pm to 5pm

The following bus stops will not be serviced on bus Route 43:

  • Larcombe Park/Barrabool Road
  • 41571 – Barwon Boulevard
  • Cedar Grove/Mt Pleasant Road
  • Barwon Water Reserve/Scenic Road
  • Desmond Street/Scenic Road
  • 21 Buckley Falls Road
  • Buckley Falls Road/Highett Road
  • Scenic Road/Highett Road
  • Sloanne Court/Province Boulevard
  • Barrabool Hills Baptist Church/Province Boulevard
  • Lansbury Crescent/Scenic Road
  • Cedar Grove/Mt Pleasant Road
  • Barwon Boulevard/Mt Pleasant Road

Sunday 2 February

 Regional train

Getting to Geelong

Passengers can catch regular services arriving at Geelong Railway Station.

Leaving Geelong

Passengers can catch regular services departing Geelong Railway Station.

Regional bus

Due to temporary and rolling road closures in place for the UCI Men’s Elite Road Race, there will be delays and service changes to bus Routes 1, 20, 22, 24, 25, 30, 31, 41, 42, 51, 52, 53, 54, 55, 56, 60, 61 and 101 (Apollo Bay - Geelong) around Geelong, the Bellarine and Surf Coast

The following bus stops will not be serviced on bus Route 24:

  • Kilgour Street/Moorabool Street

The following bus stops will not be serviced on bus Route 43:
